events.message: The applicant submitted a loan request to cover medical expenses that exceeded their current savings.
The submitted application was reviewed and categorized as a personal loan due to its use for medical purposes.
A loan officer was assigned to handle the application and start the evaluation process promptly.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the application and identified documents needed for processing.
Official requests were sent to the applicant for medical bills, income statements, and identification documents.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documentation, including detailed hospital invoices and income proof.
A credit report was obtained showing the applicant's history, which was satisfactory though with minor outstanding debts.
The risk team evaluated the credit report and documentation to determine the likelihood of timely repayment.
An offer outlining loan terms, interest rate, and repayment plan was formally presented to the applicant.
The applicant responded with acceptance after some clarifying questions about the monthly payment amount were answered.
Due to the loan amount, the application was escalated to senior management for final approval verification.
Senior management approved the loan application based on all submitted documents and risk assessment outcomes.
The approved loan amount was disbursed to the applicantâ€™s bank account to cover the medical treatment expenses.
Follow-up was conducted with the applicant to confirm receipt of funds and satisfaction with the loan terms.
The loan application was officially closed after successful funding and positive post-disbursement feedback.
